message.raw:
Fix issue #37, incorrect transition to manual/buffered semantics for novatech.

It appears that it was a misunderstanding to think of 'm 0' 'm a' and 'm n' as
three options for the phase mode (with 'm 0' meaning 'default' - corresponding
to one of the others). Rather, 'm n' and 'm a' are the two options
for the phase mode, and 'm 0' and 'm t' are for switching between table mode
and single-tone mode.

Therefore this PR calls 'm 0' at startup, and then one of 'm a' or 'm n' to set
the phase mode, which is now by default 'continuous', with 'default' having been
removed as an option, but being interpreted as 'continuous' for the case of
already-compiled shots that used it.

Thereafter, transition between single-tone mode and table mode is done with
'm 0' and 'm t', with no further calls to set the phase mode.

Also added a better explanation of the 'double clutch' hack.

message.raw:
move wait monitor error checking to compilation time, and ensure that
start_order and stop_order of separate wait monitor timeout and acquisition
devices are configured as required to ensure that the subprocess otherwise
belonging to the acquisition device will be able to control the timeout device
without contention from tasks in the other process.

message.raw:
Fix that ensures camera is set to use Format7, Mode0.

In so doing, it now defaults the 'ImageMode' settings to be the full sensor
with 'MONO8' pixel format on initialization of the device. User specified
'ImageMode' parameters override these defaults.

message.raw:
Add automatic configuration of packet size for GigE cameras.

Device will now automatically set to the largest possible packet size available
on the network. If Jumbo Frames are not available, print a warning. This also
prints what the packet size is set to if it is changed.

message.raw:
Uniformity in how AO and DO tables are checked for being all zero.

not np.any(A) is more memory efficient than np.all(A==0), as it doesn't have to
construct the intermediate array of bools.

message.raw:
Write all DO at once instead of iterating over ports.

This resolves an issue raised in the mailing list:
https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/labscriptsuite/pO6CGa4GsRI

in which some devices are unhappy about the explicit buffer configuration
required when making multiple writes of data to the same task. By making a
single write only, we allow the DAQmx driver to make decisions about buffers
itself, which the NI-PCI-DIO-32HS seems to require.

message.raw:
Fix issue #36: BLACS freezing in IMAQdxCamera continuous acquisition.

* Merged `ImageReceiver.update()` and `ImageReceiver.handler()` and have the
  whole method run in the Qt main thread.

 * Use new zprocess functionality to respond to worker process immediately to
   allow it to begin acquiring the next frame whilst the parent process is
   rendering the previous frame

* Add zprocess version requirement for this functionality.

* Call QApplication.sendPostedEvents() to prevent a backlog of paint events and
  other events that can otherwise build up at high frame rates and have been
  observed to freeze the GUI.
message.html:

  • Merged ImageReceiver.update() and ImageReceiver.handler() and have the
    whole method run in the Qt main thread.

  • Use new zprocess functionality to respond to worker process immediately to
    allow it to begin acquiring the next frame whilst the parent process is
    rendering the previous frame

  • Add zprocess version requirement for this functionality.

  • Call QApplication.sendPostedEvents() to prevent a backlog of paint events and
    other events that can otherwise build up at high frame rates and have been
    observed to freeze the GUI.

Fix issue #36: BLACS freezing in IMAQdxCamera continuous acquisition.

* Merged `ImageReceiver.update()` and `ImageReceiver.handler()` and have the
  whole method run in the Qt main thread.

 * Use new zprocess functionality to respond to worker process immediately to
   allow it to begin acquiring the next frame whilst the parent process is
   rendering the previous frame

* Add zprocess version requirement for this functionality.

* Call QApplication.sendPostedEvents() to prevent a backlog of paint events and
  other events that can otherwise build up at high frame rates and have been
  observed to freeze the GUI.

which if not present defaults to 'user_devices'.

TODO: make the installer set this configuration setting in new labconfig files
to its default value, and make it create the userlib/user_devices folder.

message.raw:
In andor_solis.py, added two SDK methods for downloading oldest 16 bit frames
in the buffer. Also added several status code errors that invalidate operations.
A third SDK method inspects the max Images that can be trasnferred on a DMA
transaction was also added.

In andor utils.py, merged a lot of the logic coming out of tests in the lab
mostly relevant to crop mode download acquisition and fast kinetics modes.
Incorporated changes to temperature control logic from R.P. Anderson and a few
things to the EMCCD settings. There are a few changes in the vertical shifting
speed setup as well to differentiate FK from other modes. Simplified some of
the readout setup lines. All of this needs testing!

In blacks_workers.py, added some printing statements as well as the FK mode
download lines. These handle the correct shaping as the data comes.

runviewer_parsers.py was still the same as when I copied it from another device

message.raw:
Fix a deadlock restarting IMAQdxCamera.

If restart was clicked whilst continuously acquiring, the ImageReceiver could
be waiting on the previous frame to be updated, and thus would not respond to
the request to shutdown. However since shutdown() was called from the main thread,
it would be waiting forever.

Now it regularly checks self.stopping (an attribute set bt the parent class
zprocess.ZMQServer when a shutdown has been requested) while waiting for the
update event to process, so that it does not deadlock.

Also, if the update event runs but finds that it has already been shut down,
it does nothing, since the Qt widgets may have been destroyed already.

values.message:
Fix a deadlock restarting IMAQdxCamera.

If restart was clicked whilst continuously acquiring, the ImageReceiver could
be waiting on the previous frame to be updated, and thus would not respond to
the request to shutdown. However since shutdown() was called from the main thread,
it would be waiting forever.

Now it regularly checks self.stopping (an attribute set bt the parent class
zprocess.ZMQServer when a shutdown has been requested) while waiting for the
update event to process, so that it does not deadlock.

Also, if the update event runs but finds that it has already been shut down,
it does nothing, since the Qt widgets may have been destroyed already.

message.raw:
RfBlaster device drivers are not working under Py3.
BLACS tabs read status but cannot set static freq/amp/phase on the kloned
webserver.
Nor can they seem to upload binary compiled DDS data to the RfB RAM.
Suspect error is in RFBlaster.py multipart form POSTing code.
Changing to using requests.

message.raw:
Adds a sub-class of IMAQdxCamera for use with the FlyCapture2/PyCapture2 backend
for Point Grey cameras.

Camera attributes are set by a nested dictionary due to inherent craziness of
the FlyCapture2 API. Due to this, camera settings can't be saved to the h5 file
since nested dictionaries are not natively supported by h5py.
